justification: Classic triad of fever, lymphadenopathy (especially cervical), and pharyngitis. Hand erythema ( slapped cheek rash) can also be present}, {diagnosis: Streptococcal pharyngitis
justification: Common cause of fever and cervical lymphadenopathy,  hand erythema can be present with scarlet fever}, {diagnosis: Kawasaki disease
justification: Fever, cervical lymphadenopathy, and erythema of the palms and soles are characteristic features}, {diagnosis: Cat scratch disease
justification: Presents with lymphadenopathy (often cervical) and can be accompanied by fever and rash}, {diagnosis: Lyme disease
justification: Early localized Lyme disease can cause fever, lymphadenopathy, and erythema migrans (bulls-eye rash), though erythema may not always be classic}, {diagnosis: Viral infection (other)
justification: Many viral infections can cause fever, lymphadenopathy, and rash}, {diagnosis: Urinary tract infection (UTI)
justification: Explains the pyuria, and fever and lymphadenopathy can occur, particularly with upper UTI}, {diagnosis: Adult-onset Stills disease
justification: Systemic inflammatory disorder that can present with fever, rash, and lymphadenopathy}, {diagnosis: Systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)
justification: Autoimmune disease that can manifest with fever, rash, lymphadenopathy, and various systemic symptoms}, {diagnosis: Leukemia
justification: Can present with fever, lymphadenopathy, and rash due to bone marrow involvement}
